[ 2 syll. ep-hron, eph-r- on ] The baby boy name Ephron is pronounced as eh-FRahN †. Ephron is used mostly in English and Hebrew, and its language of origin is Hebrew. Ephron is a derivative (English and Hebrew) of the Hebrew name Efron. Ephron is also a derivative of the English, German, and Hebrew name Ephraim. Ephron is not popular as a baby name for boys. It is not in the top 1000 names.

The name Ephron in the Bible. The name Ephron is applied three times in the Bible, although they all may have something to do with each other: 1  The first Ephron we meet in the Bible is a Hittite, a son of Zohar, from whom Abraham purchased the cave at Machpelah in order to bury Sarah (Genesis 23:8).

Ephron meaning. For a meaning of the name Ephron, NOBSE Study Bible Name List appears to take the waw-nun extension quite liberally as a kind of adjective-maker and reads Fawn-like. Jones' Dictionary of Old Testament Proper Names sees in our waw-nun form an intensitive and proposes A Great And Choice Fawn. Ephron /eph-ron/ [2 sylls.] as a name for boys. Ephron's root is Hebrew, and the name Ephron means singing bird. Ephron is an alternate form of Efron (Hebrew). Compare surname Ephrem. Ephron is an uncommon first name for males but a somewhat popular last name for both adults and children (#130443 out of 150436, Top 87%). (2000 U.S. Census).
